input_text:
Job Title: Dispatcher

Location: York, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Discover Whatâ€™s Next For Your Career.

Join our team and immediately become part of the largest distributor of conventional, natural, organic and specialty products in the United States and Canada. We serve over 43,000 customer locations with 200,000 different products. Our Warehouse associates supply thousands of consumers with better for you food that nourishes families nationwide. Our retailers range from small family-owned stores to Whole Foods Markets and everything in between. Are you ready to make an impact on the lives of others and feel good about what you do? Join our growing Distribution team today!

PURPOSE:

Responsible for dispatching trucks for on-time departure. Monitors drivers and shares info with effected customers to notify them of potential late deliveries or problems.

Job Responsibilities:

Percentage Processes customer invoices and assembles delivery paperwork.Monitors shipping and route progress in SCI and PeopleNet Link and verifies on-time arrivals.Breaks down driver packets and processes customer invoices.Collaborates with Customer for late truck notifications. May engage Customers Care for service escalations.Sorts, separates, and files invoices, route packets, and driver inspections.Completes data entry of equipment information, driver start/end times, and actual delivery times.Handles all incoming calls and emails. 10% Re-dispatch drivers as needed for coverage and to support on-time deliveries.Dispatch repair services for equipment break downs and handle accident reporting procedures.Maintains a clean and safe working environment.Reports violations of company policy to supervisor.Performs other relevant job duties as required.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Education/ Certifications/or Equivalent combination of education training and experience:

High School Diploma/GED and/or equivalent related experience

Experience:

Transportation/Dispatch experience preferred but not required Knowledge/ Skills/ Abilities:Understanding of Safety guidelinesMust have the ability to react to fast-paced, stressful situations in a calm, professional and efficient mannerAbility to prioritize and work independently with good organizational and time management skills.Must have good communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of employees.Astute, close attention to detailProficient in Microsoft Office ApplicationsFamiliar with delivery routes and DOT rules and regulationsUnderstanding of procedures in other areas of the warehouse for a more global understanding of all processes

PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT/ DEMANDS:

Most work is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment.Incumbent may sit for long periods of time at desk or computer terminal.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.Incumbent may use calculators, keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during normal workday.Stooping, bending, twisting, and reaching may be required in completion of job duties.Infrequently exposed to temperatures ranging from 20 degrees to 90 degrees Fahrenheit in the dock area or outside the work areaSpecific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the work performed by the employees assigned to this job. All employees must comply with Company policy and applicable laws. The responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified may vary within each department and/or location.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Dispatcher
output_json.summary: Join our team and become part of the largest distributor of conventional, natural, organic, and specialty products in the US and Canada.
job_responsibilities: Processes customer invoices and assembles delivery paperwork
Breaks down driver packets and processes customer invoices
Collaborates with customers for late truck notifications
Engages Customer Care for service escalations
Sorts, separates, and files invoices, route packets, and driver inspections
Enters data on equipment information, driver start/end times, and actual delivery times
Handles all incoming calls and emails
Manages repair services for equipment breakdowns
Maintains a clean and safe working environment
output_json.physical_requirements: Most work is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment. Incumbent may sit for long periods of time at desk or computer terminal. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. Incumbent may use calculators, keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during normal workday. Stooping, bending, twisting, and reaching may be required in completion of job duties. Infrequently exposed to temperatures ranging from 20 degrees to 90 degrees Fahrenheit in the dock area or outside the work area.
output_json.company_information: largest distributor of conventional, natural, organic, and specialty products in the United States and Canada

other.content:
High School Diploma/GED and/or equivalent related experience
Transportation/Dispatch experience preferred but not required
Knowledge/ Skills/ Abilities: Understanding of Safety guidelines
Must have the ability to react to fast-paced, stressful situations in a calm, professional and efficient manner
Ability to prioritize and work independently with good organizational and time management skills
Must have good communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of employees
Astute, close attention to detail
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications
Familiar with delivery routes and DOT rules and regulations
Understanding of procedures in other areas of the warehouse for a more global understanding of all processes

Most work is performed in a temperature-controlled office environment. Incumbent may sit for long periods of time at desk or computer terminal. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. Incumbent may use calculators, keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during normal workday. Stooping, bending, twisting, and reaching may be required in completion of job duties. Infrequently exposed to temperatures ranging from 20 degrees to 90 degrees Fahrenheit in the dock area or outside the work area.
